1.subquestion: Can we write the year 2004 as a multiple of 12 plus some other number?

subanswer.text: Yes, because every fourth year is a leap year which makes the pattern $12 \times (0), 12 \times (1) , 12 \times (2) ...$. This means we have the years: $12 \times 167, 12 \times 168, 12 \times 169 ... 12 \times 168+2=12 \times 168+12+2 = 12(169)+2$. The answer is yes.
